result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicole L. Schmidt was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 16CM152, 16CM294, & 16TR2002 cases called at 11:13 am. Defendant Nicole L. Schmidt in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated by ADA Anderson.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 16CM152 & No Contest to 16CM294. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 16CM152 & dismisses 16TR2002.  Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and place on probation for a period of 2 years on each case. CONDITIONS on 16CM152- 45 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day time served. To begin immediately.  $1,744 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond on file to be applied. 24 months DL Revocation, 24 month IID. AODA and follow throught, Absolute Sobriety, No bars unless for employment purposes.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. CONDITIONS ON 16CM294-AODA and follow through, Absolute Sobriety, No Bars unless for employment purposes, Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 11:15 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Nicole L. Schmidt in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin. Atty Goldin appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Goldin requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Corrected Bond Form as to Case Numbers

ADDRESS INFO for Nicole L. Schmidt
Current: W667 Buttercup Ct, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2016)
Prior: 667 Buttercup Ct, Berlin, WI 54923 United States
Status conference on September 29, 2016 at 09:05 am.

BOND TO INCLUDE BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS.  2016CM000152 AND 2016CM000294:  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles.

16CM-152 and 16CM-294 - Both Cases Called @ 2:12 PM: Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Goldin not yet appointed on new matter.   Requests one add'l STC be scheduled.  Defendant appears in person.  Defendant is instructed to contact SPD for eligibility.  16CM-294:    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and permissible punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Defendant wants counsel and Court refers Def to SPD for eligibility process.   NGP entered by Court as to new matter.   ADA argues for new bond.  No objection by Def.  The Court:  Orders one single bond that applies to both cases.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 09:05 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 2:55 PM: Defendant Nicole L. Schmidt in court, appearing pro se.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  DA serves AC - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and intends to hire her own counsel.  Court will proceed with the understanding she will retain her own counsel.  NGP entered by Court.   In person STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
